meanings.definition: To cover or become covered with crud.
meanings.sent1: The car was crudding with mud after the off-road trip.
meanings.sent2: I crudded my hands with paint while working on the art project.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally crudded his shirt with ketchup during lunch.
meanings.sent4: The old book was crudding with dust on the forgotten shelf.
meanings.sent5: The neglected garden was crudding with weeds, needing attention.

meanings.definition: Used as a mild swear word or expletive.
meanings.sent1: Crudding! I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: She exclaimed, 'Crudding! I missed the bus again.'
meanings.sent3: Crudding! I spilled my drink all over the table.
meanings.sent4: The child shouted, 'Crudding! I dropped my ice cream.'
meanings.sent5: Crudding! I can't believe I lost my keys again.

meanings.definition: A substance that is dirty, unpleasant, or of little value.
meanings.sent1: The corner of the room was filled with crudding from the construction work.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned the kitchen counter, removing all the crudding left behind.
meanings.sent3: The crudding on the sidewalk made it slippery after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The old shed was full of crudding that needed to be thrown away.
meanings.sent5: The crudding in the drain caused a blockage in the pipes.
